title: Minnesota lawmaker proposes a recycling fix for a sea of leftover boat shrink wrap - Star Tribune
summary: The article is about a bill that would require the producers of boat wrap to provide for the collection and recycling of the material, which has value for making new products out of its resin. Although recycling options for boat wrap have come and gone over the years, a new pilot project in Rogers, Minnesota intends to recycle 90 million pounds of polyethylene packaging and film. The legislation would get people talking about the value of recycling boat wrap and may lead to a lasting solution for this environmental problem.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article describes a new recycling process that has the potential to solve a major environmental problem: the disposal of boat wrap in landfills.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article describes a new recycling process that is a significant improvement over the current way of disposing of boat wrap.
